 Around the Web 






                                    @HTC                                
                                HTC Teases What Seems to be the One M10                            


                        HTC wasn't able to make it to MWC 2016 to show off their next flagship but they're teasing it now that the commotion has started to die down. The official HTC Twitter page has published an image of what is likely their upcoming flagship with the text "HTC Power of 10" under it. This image looks strikingly similar to the recently leaked photo that's been going around.                        



0 Comments 



                                        Feb 24, 2016                                    


 Go to Source










                                    Coca-Cola                                
                                Coca-Cola is Experimenting with Converting 12-Pack Boxes into Google Cardboard Viewers                            


                        The Coca-Cola Company is testing some ways for them to let customers turn their finished 12-Pack Boxes into Google Cardboard VR viewers. If successful, it would be the world's first VR viewer made from recycled packaging. They've even posted up a video to show you how the process would work, but it's unclear if they will bring this product to market just yet.                        



0 Comments 



                                        Feb 24, 2016                                    


 Go to Source










                                    Get It Now                                
                                Twitter Releases an App for Fabric, Their Mobile Development SDK                            


                        Fabric is Twitter's mobile SDK for developers to monitor their crash reporting, app log-ins, embedding/sharing Twitter posts, measuring ad effectiveness and more. The company has just released an Android application that will give you real-time metrics and alerts for any mobile application you have that uses the free SDK.                        



0 Comments 



                                        Feb 24, 2016                                    


 Go to Source










                                    Google Design                                
                                Google Releases a Resizer Tool for Developers to Test the Responsiveness of their Websites                            


                        Google's Android is made to run on devices with a plethora of screen sizes. This was integral in the company's design philosophy with Material Design too and now the company has released a resizer tool for web developers to test the responsiveness of their websites. Simply enter a web address at the top and you can see how it looks on devices of multiple sizes.

                                    DisplayMate                                
                                DispalyMate Crowns the Galaxy S7 as the Best Smartphone Display                            


                        DisplayMate had previously said the Galaxy Note 5 had the best smartphone display they had ever tested. Now that the Galaxy S7 is out, the company has done a shoot-out with it and they say it "leapfrogs" the Galaxy Note 5. The results show the S7 matches or breaks records for Absolute Color Accuracy, Peak Brightness, Contrast Rating in Ambient Light and Brightness Variation with Viewing Angle.

This image looks strikingly similar to the recently leaked photo that's been going around.

                                    Coca-Cola                                
                                Coca-Cola is Experimenting with Converting 12-Pack Boxes into Google Cardboard Viewers                            


                        The Coca-Cola Company is testing some ways for them to let customers turn their finished 12-Pack Boxes into Google Cardboard VR viewers. If successful, it would be the world's first VR viewer made from recycled packaging. They've even posted up a video to show you how the process would work, but it's unclear if they will bring this product to market just yet.

                        DisplayMate had previously said the Galaxy Note 5 had the best smartphone display they had ever tested. The results show the S7 matches or breaks records for Absolute Color Accuracy, Peak Brightness, Contrast Rating in Ambient Light and Brightness Variation with Viewing Angle.

                                    Xiaomi                                
                                Xiaomi Announces the Mi 4S During Latest Product Launch                            


                        Along with the launch of the Mi 5, Xiaomi has announced the refined Mi 4S as well. The Mi 4S has better specs than the original Mi 4, but doesn't outshine the Mi 5. The device has a 5" 1080p display, Snapdragon 808, 3GB RAM, 64GB storage, microSD card slot, 13MP rear camera, fingerprint sensor, 3,260mAh battery with support for Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0, USB Type-C and MIUI 7 on top.

                                Activision Completes its Acquisition of King, the Makers of Candy Crush
